com.edugility.liquiunit
Class LiquiunitRule

java.lang.Object
  org.junit.rules.ExternalResource
      com.edugility.liquiunit.LiquiunitRule
All Implemented Interfaces:
TestRule
public class LiquiunitRule
extends ExternalResource

An ExternalResource that performs a Liquibase update operation before a given test run.

Author:
Laird Nelson
See Also:
before(), Liquibase.update(String), ExternalResource

Field Detail

logger

protected final Logger logger
The Logger to use for debugging and tracing purposes.

This field is never null.

Constructor Detail

LiquiunitRule

public LiquiunitRule(DataSource dataSource,
                     String... contexts)
Creates a new LiquiunitRule.

The new LiquiunitRule will have a changelog resource name of "changelog.xml", and a ResourceAccessor initialized with the following code:

new CompositeResourceAccessor(new URLResourceAccessor(Thread.currentThread().getContextClassLoader()), 
                              new FileSystemResourceAccessor(System.getProperty("user.dir")))

Consider passing an H2Rule as the value for the dataSource parameter for thread-safe parallel in-memory database testing scenarios.

Parameters:
dataSource - the DataSource to use to acquire a Connection; may be null in which case this LiquiunitRule will effectively do nothing
contexts - a variable number of Liquibase contexts; may be null
See Also:
DataSource.getConnection(String, String), setContexts(Iterable), setResourceAccessor(ResourceAccessor), setChangeLogResourceName(String)
Method Detail

getChangeLogResourceName

public String getChangeLogResourceName()
Returns the classpath resource name of the changelog that the associated Liquibase instance should use during its update operation.

This method may return null.

At construction time, this property is set to "changelog.xml".

Returns:
the classpath resource name of the changelog that the associated Liquibase instance should use during its update operation, or null
See Also:
setChangeLogResourceName(String), LiquiunitRule(DataSource, String[])

setChangeLogResourceName

public void setChangeLogResourceName(String name)
Sets the classpath resource name of the changelog that the associated Liquibase instance should use during its update operation.

Parameters:
name - the classpath resource name of the changelog that the associated Liquibase instance should use during its update operation; may be null
See Also:
getChangeLogResourceName()

getContexts

public Iterable<? extends String> getContexts()
Returns an Iterable of Liquibase contexts for use during the update operation.

This method may return null.

Returns:
an Iterable of Strings, or null
See Also:
setContexts(Iterable), Liquibase.update(String)

setContexts

public void setContexts(Iterable<? extends String> contexts)
Sets the Iterable representing the Liquibase contexts for use during the update operation.

Parameters:
contexts - an Iterable of Strings representing the Liquibase contexts for use during the update operation; may be null
See Also:
getContexts(), Liquibase.update(String)

before

protected void before()
               throws LiquibaseException,
                      SQLException
Overrides the ExternalResource.before() method to acquire a Connection, find the proper Liquibase Database implementation, create a Liquibase instance and, using it, update the backing database using the affiliated changelog.

Overrides:
before in class ExternalResource
Throws:
LiquibaseException - if there was a Liquibase-related error
SQLException - if there was a database-related error
See Also:
DataSource.getConnection(String, String), createLiquibase(Database), shouldUpdate(Liquibase), getContexts(), Liquibase.update(String)

createLiquibase

protected Liquibase createLiquibase(Database database)
                             throws LiquibaseException
Tries to load the classpath resource identifying a Liquibase changelog, and, if successful, creates a new Liquibase instance initialized to read from it, and returns it.

This method may return null.

Parameters:
database - the Database to operate on; must not be null
Returns:
a new configured Liquibase instance, or null if there is no changelog to read and hence no reason to construct a Liquibase instance
Throws:
LiquibaseException - if a problem occurred while constructing the new Liquibase instance
See Also:
changeLogResourceExists(), getResourceAccessor()

changeLogResourceExists

protected boolean changeLogResourceExists()
Returns true if the changelog identified by the return value of the getChangeLogResourceName() method actually exists.

Returns:
true if the changelog identified by the return value of the getChangeLogResourceName() method actually exists; false otherwise
See Also:
getChangeLogResourceName()

getResourceAccessor

public ResourceAccessor getResourceAccessor()
Returns the ResourceAccessor associated with this LiquiunitRule that will be used by the createLiquibase(Database) method while creating a Liquibase instance.

This method may return null.

A newly created LiquiunitRule will, by default, have a ResourceAccessor initialized with the following code:

new CompositeResourceAccessor(new URLResourceAccessor(Thread.currentThread().getContextClassLoader()), 
                              new FileSystemResourceAccessor(System.getProperty("user.dir")))

Returns:
a ResourceAccessor, or null
See Also:
setResourceAccessor(ResourceAccessor)

setResourceAccessor

public void setResourceAccessor(ResourceAccessor resourceAccessor)
Sets the ResourceAccessor associated with this LiquiunitRule that will be used by the createLiquibase(Database) method while creating a Liquibase instance.

Parameters:
resourceAccessor - a ResourceAccessor; may be null
See Also:
getResourceAccessor()

shouldUpdate

protected boolean shouldUpdate(Liquibase liquibase)
                        throws LiquibaseException,
                               SQLException
Returns true if the supplied Liquibase instance should in fact have its Liquibase.update(String) method called.

This implementation returns true if the Liquibase.SHOULD_RUN_SYSTEM_PROPERTY system property is non-null and set to something other than false and if the supplied Liquibase instance is non-null and is connected to a database that does not yet have a DATABASECHANGELOG table in it.

Parameters:
liquibase - the Liquibase instance to check; may be null in which case false will be returned
Returns:
true if the supplied Liquibase instance should in fact have its Liquibase.update(String) method called
Throws:
LiquibaseException - if there was a Liquibase-related error
SQLException - if there was a database-related error
See Also:
Liquibase.update(String)
